strIntroduction: Visit Kamikochi in Nagano and spend your day walking around that area, where you can enjoy the beautiful scenery of its nature! This bus tour will depart from Shinjuku early in the morning and will take you to Kamikochi area for a walking tour. Kamikochi is known as the diamond crown of the Japanese Alps, for its tremendous scenery. The scenic area of Kamikochi is a basin at 1500 m elevation, creating a magnificent background with a wonderful aquamarine Azusa River in the foreground. Kamikochi is a very popular spot for mountain trekking, which starting point is the famous bridge: Kappa-bashi. Kappa-bashi was built in 1891 on the River Azusa, which later became the iconic symbol of Kamikochi. Kappa-bashi is a wooden suspension bridge, located within 5-minute walk from Kamikochi’s coach terminal. In addition to Kappa-bashi, you can enjoy the scenic view of Taisho Pond that provides perfect reflections of the Hotaka Mountains, and walk around the Mt. Yake. This bus tour includes a lunch box, which you can enjoy while seeing the beautiful view of Kamikochi’s great nature! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: - Depart from Shinjuku at 6:50 - Walk around Kamikochi area (4 hours) - Return to Shinjuku and tour ends at 21:30 The tour departs on Sep 27, Oct 3, 12, & 14, and Nov 3 of 2016 Make a reservation for this tour and enjoy the beautiful scenic of Kamikochi area this Autumn! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: Visit Hyogo and try one of its best delicatessen, Kasumi crab this fall! Visit Amarube Railway Bridge to see the beautiful sea of Japan! Stroll around Kinosaki Onsen Town, an old town that has 1,300 years of history! In addition, visit Genbudo Cave, which is famous as one of Japan’s best spiritual spots! This bus tour departs from Kyoto station and will take you to Hyogo prefecture, where you can enjoy many delicious food and visit many historical places. You will visit Hamasaka, where you can enjoy eating Hyogo’s most famous crab, Kasumi crab. You will have the crab lunch course that include: whole Kasumi crab (100-150 g), boiled red snow crab (2 legs), flaked crab meat, Chinese style shark fin hot pot with starchy sauce, gratin in a crab shell, crab’s miso-like paste, crab porridge, etc. You can upgrade the amount of whole Kasumi crab to 400 g per portion by choosing the option menu when booking. After lunch, you will visit Michi No Eki “Amarube” to visit Amarube Railway Bridge’s “Sora No Eki” observation site, where you can enjoy the astonishing view of Sea of Japan. Later, you will visit Kinosaki Onsen Town, a representative hot spring district of Kansai that has more than 1,300 years of history and walk around there. Before returning to Kyoto, you will visit Genbudo Cave, which is a natural monument of Japan, formed by a magma eruption around 1,600,000 years ago. The itinerary for this bus tour is as follows: - Meet at Kyoto Station Hachijo Exit at 7:20 - Visit Hamasaka for Kasumi crab lunch (60 minutes) - Michi no Eki “Amarube” and visit Amarube Railway Bridge for its “Sora no Eki” observation site (40 minutes) - Walk around Kinosaki Onsen Town - Visit Genbudo Cave (40 minutes) - Visit Wadayama - Return to Kyoto - Tour ends in between 19:30-20:30 This tour departs from Kyoto on September 16, 25, &30, and October 6 & 15 of 2016. Fill your tummy with Hyogo’s specialty Kasumi crab and enjoy strolling around Hyogo prefecture for its historical places with no hassles by making a reservation with Voyagin’s services! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2
strTitle: Visit Hyogo To Enjoy Kasumi Crab Lunch This Fall!

strIntroduction: Visit Mie prefecture for its unique culture and delicious food to fulfill your autumn appetite! Explore the Shigaraki-yaki Togei Village for its beautiful ceramic ware, and have an all-you-can-eat Matsuzaka beef and grilled matsutake mushrooms for lunch! Also visit Ise Shrine, one of the most famous shrines in Mie before returning to Umeda or Namba! This bus tour departs from Umeda or Namba, and will take you to Mie prefecture to visit Shigaraki-yaki Togei village, where you can shop Mie’s beautiful Shigaraki ceramic ware before you head to the restaurant to have your lunch. You will visit either Meihan Seki or Ueno for lunch, where you can have an all-you-can-eat Matsuzaka beef, grilled matsutake mushrooms, and steamed rice with matsutake mushroom! In addition, you can also enjoy these a la carte menu as well: steamed dish (vegetable, matsutake), matsutake in a fish cake, simmered matsutake with seatweed, and matsutake soup. Matsuzaka beef is famous for its juicy taste, and it is one of the most popular wagyu brand in Japan. Matsutake is fall's best delicatessens, which has very tempting good smell! After lunch, you will visit Mie’s famous Ise Shrine and explore its Naiku (inner area of the shrine) as well. strIntroduction: This tour takes you from Nagano Station all the way to the world famous snow monkeys at the Jigokudani Monkey Park in some of the coldest months of the year. Around this time, plenty of monkeys will be bathing in the hot springs to warm up from the cold. The visit to the snow monkeys is followed by an active and fun afternoon of going up into the mountains with snowshoes strapped to your feet. The meet-up is at 8:45 at Nagano Station from where you will be taken to the Jigokudani Monkey Park. There you get to see the Japanese macaques warming up their bodies by bathing in hot springs. Our staff will tell you interesting facts about the park and the monkeys while you stroll around the park. After having spent some time with the snow monkeys, we head back for a delicious lunch. After lunch, we will be ready for snowshoe part of the tour. We will head all the way up to the surrounding mountain area. This mountainous area was the scene for the 1998 Winter Olympics. Every year a huge amount of snow comes falling down from the heavens and this makes for an amazing scenery. Walking through the Japanese snowy landscape, there is a high possibility of coming across footsteps of animals that roam the region. Our staff know many ways to make the track through the snow enjoyable and will introduce you some of the best ways to get through a snowy winter. Some of the things on the menu are making a snow table and drinking warm soup in the middle of whitened nature, or making a natural snow slide and sliding down from the top! Tour Itinerary: 08:45 Meet up at Nagano Station under the East Exit information board opposite of the Shinkansen exit. 10:00 Welcome to the Snow Monkey area! Walk for 30 minutes along a forest trail to the Snow Monkey Park where you get to enjoy the wild monkeys playing around. 12:15 Have delicious lunch nearby the Snow Monkey Park! 13:00 Leave the lunch restaurant and get taken to the mountainous area for some snow hiking fun! 17:00 Tour finishes and time to be transported back to Yudanaka Station. 17:35 Arrival at Yudanaka Station. A train back to Nagano Station leaves Yudanaka at 17:50. 19:00 Arrive back to Nagano Station.
strTitle: Full Day Snow Monkey and Snow Shoe Hiking Tour

strIntroduction: Meet at Hashimoto Station or Yagi Yamato Station, then take the train to the trail head of Choishi Michi Pilgrimage Trail. The trail winds its way through the beautiful Japanese countryside. From the station to Daimon gate will take about 3 hours at a medium and relaxing pace. After taking some photos of the large red Daimon Gate we will catch a bus to Okunoin Temple and grab lunch at a Japanese Restaurant. This is easily one of the most beautiful places in Japan. The oldest cemetery in Japan is filled with moss covered graves that lie underneath the shadows of giant trees. We will then walk along a forested path through the graves to the central Koyasan (Mt Koya) area. Here you will have an hour or so to stroll around and look for souvenirs. We will finish off our visit to Koyasan by stopping off at Kongobuji Temple. This is the head temple of Koyasan Shingu Buddhism. Take a bus to Koyasan station and return by train to starting station.
strTitle: Walk the Koyasan (Mt Koya) Pilgrimage Trail
